result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan M. Geurts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan M. Geurts

defendant.name: Geurts, Nathan M.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 1:51 p.m. Defendant Nathan M. Geurts in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Ct 1  - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.

Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.    The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:30 PM: Defendant Nathan M. Geurts in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel at this time. NGP received and entered.   ADA argues for $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection by Def.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Court would entertain a written request for telephone appearance if Def wishes to appear telephonically for P/S hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
